meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the equilibrium of liquids and the pressure exerted by liquids at rest.
meanings.sent1: The hydrostatic pressure in the water tank kept the liquid balanced.
meanings.sent2: The hydrostatic forces in the pool were crucial for maintaining stability.
meanings.sent3: The hydrostatic nature of the pond made it a peaceful spot for fishing.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like a hydrostatic force in the chaotic room.
meanings.sent5: The hydrostatic equilibrium of the lake was disrupted by the jumping fish.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to hydrostatics, the branch of science dealing with the mechanical properties of fluids.
meanings.sent1: The hydrostatic experiments in the lab fascinated the students.
meanings.sent2: His research focused on hydrostatic principles in fluid mechanics.
meanings.sent3: The hydrostatic study group met every Friday to discuss their findings.
meanings.sent4: The hydrostatic analysis revealed interesting patterns in the fluid behavior.
meanings.sent5: The hydrostatic properties of the liquid were carefully examined under the microscope.
